title: Offering wrong animal species
vignette: A person designates a sheep for an atonement offering but accidentally prepares a goat instead.

options.text: Invalidate the offering and bring another correctly.
Accept it since both are approved for consumption species.

title: Intending to eat after allowed time
vignette: During preparation the community elder imagines eating the meat the next day, which would be beyond the time limit.

options.text: His improper thought disqualifies the offering.
Thoughts alone cannot invalidate an otherwise proper act.

title: Minor imperfection in the community elder
vignette: A community elder notices a small wart on his hand before officiating.

options.text: He must step aside until imperfection-free.
Such a tiny imperfection can be ignored for the service.

title: Preparation at night
vignette: The animal was mistakenly prepared after sunset.

options.text: Disqualify; offerings must be by day.
Proceed since most steps will occur by daybreak.

title: Offering outside the Central Assembly Place courtyard
vignette: A well-meaning farmer prepares his offering in a nearby field.

options.text: Invalid and punishable; offerings belong in the central assembly place.
Accept it due to his ignorance.

title: Doubtful blood application spot
vignette: The community elder is unsure if he sprinkled the blood on the correct offering place corner.

options.text: Repeat the application to remove doubt.
Rely on the initial act and continue.

title: Lost designated animal found later
vignette: After dedicating a bull, it wanders off. Another is offered in its place, then the original returns.

options.text: Both must now be sacrificed.
Only the replacement counts; release the first.

title: Extra pledge offering on a festival
vignette: Someone pledges an additional dedicatory offering during a busy holiday when the offering place is crowded.

options.text: Delay until after the festival to avoid burdening the community elders.
Bring it immediately to fulfill the pledge without delay.

title: Substitution after animal lost
vignette: He substitutes another animal for a dedicated for special use one that went missing, then the first is found alive.

options.text: Both are special status and must be offered.
Only one should be used; the other is exchanged.

title: Meat left overnight
vignette: Sacrificial portions were accidentally left unburned until the morning.

options.text: Burn them at once though the time passed.
Dispose discreetly and bring new portions.

title: Animal imperfected after dedication for special use
vignette: A dedicated for special use ram develops a limp before being offered.

options.text: exchange it and bring a sound one instead.
Offer it anyway to avoid delay.

title: Missing vessel for ritual
vignette: The special pan for certain offerings is misplaced.

options.text: Wait until the proper vessel is found or replaced.
Use a regular pot so the service proceeds.

title: Contaminated vessel for blood
vignette: A community elder discovers the bowl holding sacrificial blood was ceremonially contaminated.

options.text: Discard the blood and prepare anew.
Rinse the bowl quickly and continue with the same blood.

title: Mechanical device restraining animals
vignette: A new harness speeds handling of offerings but seems irreverent.

options.text: Avoid using gadgets; restrain by hand.
Use it to improve safety and efficiency.

title: Non-member brings an offering
vignette: A foreign resident wishes to offer in the central assembly place with sincere intent.

options.text: Allow it as a gift to the Creator.
Restrict offerings to community members only.
